articles.title: A 41,000-year-old secret could predict the next shift in Earth - Inverse
articles.description: Scientists recently discovered a 5.5 meter-long sediment core taken from the bottom of Lake Selina, Tasmania, unpacking 270,000 years of Earth's history.
articles.content:
About 41,000 years ago, something remarkable happened:
 Earths magnetic field flipped and, for a temporary period, magnetic north was south and magnetic south was north.
